Problem:
Consider a system governed by the partial differential equation \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu \\), where L is a linear differential operator. We investigate the effect of an integral transform \\( T(u) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} K(x, s) u(s, t) ds \\) on the solution u(x, t), with K being a kernel function.

If at some instant \\( t_1 \\), another transformation \\( R(u) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} H(x, s) u(s, t) ds \\) (where H is another kernel function) is applied as an intervention, will the final state \\( u(x, T) \\) for T > t_1 be independent of the transforms T and R?
Explanation: The final state \\( u(x, T) \\) will depend on both transformations T and R, as well as the evolution under L. These transformations can modify the solution path and effect in a compounded manner, determined by the convolution properties of both kernels K and H with the linear operator L.
